channel.title: Velociraptor Artifact Exchange
channel.description: Recent content in Artifact Exchange on Velociraptor - Digging deeper!

item.title: Server.Monitor.Autolabeling.Clients
item.description: This server side event monitoring artifact watches for new client enrollments and automatically labels them according to their domain roles.

item.title: Windows.Applications.AnyDesk
item.description: This parses AnyDesk logs to retrieve information about AnyDesk usage. It includes source IP addresses, AnyDesk ID's, and filetransfers.

item.title: Windows.Carving.BRc4
item.description: This artifact extracts Brute Ratel C4 (BRc4) configuration from a byte stream, process or file on disk. BRc4 is an emerging red-teaming and adversarial attack simulation tool.

item.title: MacOS.Collection.Aftermath
item.description: This is a simple artifact that leverages Afermath to collect many different forensic artifacts from a macOS host, then uploads the results to the Velociraptor server.

item.title: Windows.Detection.ISOMount
item.description: Following Microsoft's decision to block macros by default on MS Office applications, threat actors are increasingly using container files such as ISO files to distribute malware. This artifact will extract evidence of .iso files being mounted that may be malicious from the Microsoft-Windows-VHDMP-Operational EventLog. The artifact targets the string ".iso" in event IDs: 1 (mount), 2 (unmount) and 12 (type, path, handle).

item.title: MacOS.ParallelsVM.SuspendedMemory
item.description: Looks for suspended Parallels VM owned by any user on a MacOS system. Can automatically upload the virtual memory files if found.

item.title: Windows.Detection.Malfind
item.description: This artifact checks the VAD for executable sections that are not maped to disk and has suspicious content which may indicate process injection.

item.title: Windows.ETW.Powershell
item.description: This artifact enables Powershell scriptblock and commandlet load monitoring. It uses the ETW provider: Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell

item.title: MacOS.UnifiedLogParser
item.description: This is a simple, un-optimized artifact that leverages Mandiant's `macos-unifiedlogs`/`unifiedlog_parser` to obtain parsed log information from macOS's Unified Log.

item.title: Windows.ETW.DNSOfflineCollector
item.description: This artifact collects DNS queries for a specified duration. It can be used with an Offline Collector (which is not the case with Windows.ETW.DNS). It uses the artifact (Windows.ETW.DNS) that was built by Matt Green - @mgreen27

item.title: Server.Alerts.IRIS.Case.Create
item.description: Create an IRIS case when monitored artifacts complete with results. Adds the ClientId, FlowId as tags to the case. Adds the FQDN as an asset.

item.title: Server.Enrichment.IRIS.IOCLookup
item.description: Query an IRIS instance for an indicator.

item.title: Windows.Registry.COMAutoApprovalList
item.description: This artifact will return COM objects that auto-elevate and bypass UAC (these could potentially be used by adversaries/malware to elevate privileges), and cross-reference the class ID with a name where able.

item.title: Windows.Detection.MagicWeb
item.description: This artifact will find evidence of NOBELIUMâ€™s MagicWeb.

item.title: Windows.System.Services.SliverPsexec
item.description: This pack detects various artefacts left behind by default configurations of the C2 framework Sliver PsExec module

item.title: Windows.Detection.UnattendXML
item.description: This artifact will find unscrubbed passwords in unattend.xml answer files. This file is used for non interactive Windows installation.

item.title: Linux.Remediation.Quarantine
item.description: Quarantine a Linux host using iptables rules.

item.title: MacOS.Files.FileMonitor
item.description: This artifact parses Objective-See's FileMonitor log.

item.title: MacOS.Network.LittleSnitch
item.description: This is artifact parses Little Snitch's network traffic log.

item.title: Windows.Detection.Ntdsutil
item.description: This artifact will extract evidence of Ntdsutil abuse from the application eventlog. The artifact targets the string "ntds.dit" in event IDs: 216, 325, 326 and 327.

item.title: Windows.KapeFiles.Remapping
item.description: This artifact automates the rebuilding of remapping rules to be able to easily post process the results of the Windows.KapeFiles.Targets.

item.title: MacOS.Forensics.FSEvents
item.description: This artifact parses the FSEvents log files.

item.title: Server.Enrichment.MalwareBazaar
item.description: Query MalwareBazaar for a hash.

item.title: Server.Enrichment.ThreatFox
item.description: Query ThreatFox for an indicator.

item.title: Windows.Sysinternals.SysmonArchive
item.description: If configured, Sysmon EID 23: FileDelete enables archiving file deletes on disk. The challenges of this configuraiton is management of the archive folder which can grow to be significant size and use up disk space.

item.title: Windows.Events.SysmonArchiveMonitor
item.description: This artifact enables automatic management of the Sysmon archive folder.

item.title: Server.Utils.OrphanedFlows
item.description: Sometimes flows are deleted but there is still outstanding data for them in flight. The server will continue to save this data after the flow is deleted.

item.title: Windows.System.WindowsErrorReporting
item.description: Parses several Windows Error Reporting (WER) files that contain information about crashed programs.

item.title: Windows.Analysis.SuspiciousWMIConsumers
item.description: This artifact reports suspicious WMI Event Consumers and their associated Filters that may indicate a malicious abuse for persistence.

item.title: Windows.Detection.BruteRatel
item.description: This hunt runts the Immersive Labs yara rule (https://github.com/Immersive-Labs-Sec/BruteRatel-DetectionTools/blob/main/BruteRatel.yar) across select files to identify the known Brute Ratel config strings.

item.title: Windows.Remediation.KillProcess
item.description: Quick and dirty monitoring artifact to kill a process by Image Name. We monitor the Microsoft-Windows-Kernel-Process ETW provider and leverage taskkill to kill the process.

item.title: Windows.Events.SysmonRegistry
item.description: This artifact enables monitoring for registry events of interest via the Sysmon ETW proiver.

item.title: Exchange.Server.Enrichment.Gimphash
item.description: Calculate the Gimphash for a Golang binary.

item.title: Windows.Forensics.FileZilla
item.description: This artifact enumerate's all user directories on a system and will parse three files within a users AppData\Roaming\FileZilla directory: filezilla.xml, recentservers.xml, and queue.sqlite3

item.title: Server.Enrichment.EchoTrail
item.description: This is a process execution enrichment artifact that can be called from within another artifact (such as one looking at running processes) to enrich the data made available by that artifact. We are calling the EchoTrail v2 API which is still in beta.

item.title: Label.DomainController
item.description: This artifact watches for completion of the `watchArtifact` and assigns the given `setLabel` if the `WHERE` condition is matched.

item.title: Windows.EventLogs.Hayabusa
item.description: [Hayabusa](https://github.com/Yamato-Security/hayabusa) is a Windows event log fast forensics timeline generator and threat hunting tool.

item.title: Windows.EventLogs.Bitsadmin
item.description: This content will extract BITS Transfer events and enable filtering by URL

item.title: Linux.Detection.ConfluenceLogs
item.description: This artifact enables grep of Linux logs and targets strings observed in exploitation of CVE-2022-26134.

item.title: Windows.Detection.MsdtFollina
item.description: This artifact will search Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool logs for evidence of ms-msdt Follina exploitation (CVE-2022-30190).

item.title: Windows.Registry.NetshHelperDLLs
item.description: # Enumerate all NetSh Helper DLLs

item.title: Windows.EventLogs.LogonSessions
item.description: This artifact searches for logon and logoff events within Security event logs identified by Event ID 4624 and 4634. These logon/logoff events are grouped by "TargetLogonId" field into "logon sessions". For each of these logon sessions, start, end and duration are derived

item.title: Windows.System.Powershell.ISEAutoSave
item.description: This artifact hunts for Powershell ISE autosave files and extracts ISE user config.

item.title: Server.Enrichment.Virustotal.FileScan
item.description: Submit a file to Virustotal for analysis.

item.title: Windows.Events.EventLogModifications
item.description: It is possible to disable windows event logs on a per channel or per provider basis. Attackers may disable ciritcal log sources to prevent detections.

item.title: Windows.Detection.PrefetchHunter
item.description: This artifact enables hunting prefetch entries for accessed files of interest.

item.title: Windows.Registry.TaskCache.HiddenTasks
item.description: This artefact will highlight any scheduled tasks missing the Security Descriptor (SD) value in the task cache. Without this value, the task is hidden from common query methods.

item.title: Windows.NTFS.Timestomp
item.description: This artifact enables triage to detect potential time stomped files.

item.title: Windows.Applications.DefenderQuarantineExtract
item.description: Extracts Quarantine Files from Windows Defender.

item.title: Custom.Windows.Registry.CortexEDRDisabled
item.description: This artifact will attempt to identify Cortex EDR that has been disabled via regkey
